result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander J Kivioja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

10:31 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will enter a plea.  DA recites agreement - in 2015CM215 - defendant will plea to count 1 with no enhancer and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  In 2015CM127, defendant will enter a plea to count 1 and the enhancer will be dismissed.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2015CM215, strikes the enhancer and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2015CM127 and strikes the enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM127

-15 days county jail, with huber and consecutive to any other sentence
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2015CM215

-30 days county jail, with huber , consecutive to any other sentence.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.  Sentence to commence within 60 days

Court adjourned at 10:40 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-09-2016 10:30 am

1:13 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No violent contact with Megan R.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 14, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.
